Text:
Try adding permissions for the objects that are tagged inside posts. The "read stream" permission grants access to a wall post's tags but it is not clear from the documentation if it grants access to the tags of the objects a post holds as a field, e.g. the tags in a photo in a post.

The following objects can have tags, in addition to the Post object:

 - Checkins. permissions: "user_checkins","friends_checkins".
 - Photo. permissions: "user_photos","friends_photos".
 - Video. permissions: "user_videos", friends_videos".

You also need these permissions:

 - "friends_photo_video_tags".
 - "user_photo_video_tags".

You need these permissions:

    friends_photo_video_tags
    user_photo_video_tags

You may also need permissions for the objects that are tagged inside posts. The "read stream" permission grants access to a wall post's tags but it is not clear from the documentation if it grants access to the tags of the object a post holds as a field, e.g. the tags in a photo in a post.

The following objects can have tags, in addition to the Post object:

    friends_photos

Video. Permissions needed

    friends_videos

[EDIT] There are inconsistencies in the stream_tag table reported in the Facebook developer pages, based on tests run by developers. These include:

For two status updates from the same user with tagged users, the table returns tagging information correctly for one update but returns no information for the second.

The stream_tag table doesn't include tags from notes and link comments.

[Here][1] is a summary of reported issues with the stream_tag table. 


  [1]: http://fbdevwiki.com/wiki/FQL:stream_tag

There are 2 possible reason for the issue I can think of, without access to the actual data:

First reason: You need to add permissions. Specifically:

    friends_photo_video_tags
    user_photo_video_tags

You may also need permissions for the objects that are tagged inside posts. The "read stream" permission grants access to a wall post's tags but it is not clear from the documentation if it grants access to the tags of the object a post holds as a field, e.g. the tags in a photo in a post.

The following objects can have tags, in addition to the Post object:

Checkins. Permissions needed: 

    user_checkins
    friends_checkins

Photo. Permissions needed: 

    user_photos
    friends_photos

Video. Permissions needed

    user_videos
    friends_videos

Second reason: You are experiencing a bug/inconsistency in the stream_tag table. There are inconsistencies with this table reported in the Facebook developer pages, based on tests run by developers. These include:

For two status updates from the same user with tagged users, the stream_tag table returns tagging information correctly for one update but returns no information for the second.

The stream_tag table doesn't include tags from notes and link comments.

[Here][1] is a summary of reported issues with the stream_tag table. 


  [1]: http://fbdevwiki.com/wiki/FQL:stream_tag

For two status updates from the same user with tagged users, the stream_tag table returns tagging information correctly for one update but returns no information for the second.

[Here][1] is a FBDevWiki summary of reported issues with the stream_tag table, under the heading "Notes/Bugs/Gotchas". 

If adding the permissions don't help you with the FQL query, you can use the Graph API with this call which returns tags in posts, photos and videos:

    https://graph.facebook.com/USER_ID/tagged


  [1]: http://fbdevwiki.com/wiki/FQL:stream_tag

**FQL solution**

There are 2 possible reasons for the issue I can think of, without access to the actual data:

First reason: You need to add permissions. Specifically:

    friends_photo_video_tags
    user_photo_video_tags

You may also need permissions for the objects that are tagged inside posts. The "read stream" permission grants access to a wall post's tags but it is not clear from the documentation if it grants access to the tags of the object a post holds as a field, e.g. the tags in a photo in a post.

The following objects can have tags, in addition to the Post object:

Checkins. Permissions needed: 

    user_checkins
    friends_checkins

Photo. Permissions needed: 

    user_photos
    friends_photos

Video. Permissions needed

    user_videos
    friends_videos

Second reason: You are experiencing a bug/inconsistency in the stream_tag table. There are inconsistencies with this table reported in the Facebook developer pages, based on tests run by developers. These include:

For two status updates from the same user with tagged users, the stream_tag table returns tagging information correctly for one update but returns no information for the second.

The stream_tag table doesn't include tags from notes and link comments.

[Here][1] is a FBDevWiki summary of reported issues with the stream_tag table, under the heading "Notes/Bugs/Gotchas". 

**Graph API solution**

If adding the above permissions don't help with the FQL query, you can instead call the Graph API like so: 

    https://graph.facebook.com/USER_ID/tagged

which returns tags in posts, photos and videos:

  [1]: http://fbdevwiki.com/wiki/FQL:stream_tag

**Graph API solution**

which returns tags in posts, photos and videos for the user:

  [1]: http://fbdevwiki.com/wiki/FQL:stream_tag
